pdnLinkFaultMgmtMIB.name: pdnLinkFaultMgmtMIB

revisions.description: - Added pdnLinkFailureSfPeriodBeforeSwitching object, - Added pdnLinkFailureSfBerThreshold object.

pdnLinkFaultMgmtMIB.contactinfo: Paradyne Networks Inc. Postal: 8545, 126th Ave. N. Largo, FL 33779 US Editor: Jesus Pinto Email: mibwg_team@eng.paradyne.com
pdnLinkFaultMgmtMIB.description: This management information module supports the objects to be used for fault management configuration on primary and secondary links.

pdnLinkFaultMgmtApsSelection.name: pdnLinkFaultMgmtApsSelection
pdnLinkFaultMgmtApsSelection.description: This object is used to enable or disable the Automatic Protection Switching (Aps) feature on this device. This object can not be enabled if the -Switchover due to link failures- is enabled.

pdnLinkFaultMgmtSwitchoverSelection.name: pdnLinkFaultMgmtSwitchoverSelection
pdnLinkFaultMgmtSwitchoverSelection.description: This object is used to enable or disable the Switchover Due to link failures feature on on this device. This object can not be enabled if the APS feature is enabled.

pdnDualLinkSelection.name: pdnDualLinkSelection
pdnDualLinkSelection.description: This object is used to enable or disable the ability to split traffic among dual links.

pdnLinkFailureConfigTable.name: pdnLinkFailureConfigTable
pdnLinkFailureConfigTable.description: This table contains one row per link being monitored for link failures.

pdnLinkFailureConfigEntry.name: pdnLinkFailureConfigEntry
pdnLinkFailureConfigEntry.description: Configuration information about a particular interface being monitored for link failured.

pdnLinkFailureLOSPeriodBeforeSwitching.name: pdnLinkFailureLOSPeriodBeforeSwitching
pdnLinkFailureLOSPeriodBeforeSwitching.description: This object allows users to configure the amount of time a LOS condition shall exist on this uplink before initiating a switchover. Switchover due to LOS condition on this uplink will not be valid if any of the APS (Automatic Protection Switching) is enabled.

pdnLinkFailureLOFPeriodBeforeSwitching.name: pdnLinkFailureLOFPeriodBeforeSwitching
pdnLinkFailureLOFPeriodBeforeSwitching.description: This object allows users to configure the amount of time a LOF condition shall exist on this uplink before initiating a switchover. Switchover due to LOF condition on this uplink will not be valid if any of the APS (Automatic Protection Switching) is enabled.

pdnLinkFailureAISLPeriodBeforeSwitching.name: pdnLinkFailureAISLPeriodBeforeSwitching
pdnLinkFailureAISLPeriodBeforeSwitching.description: This object allows users to configure the amount of time a AIS-L condition shall exist on this uplink before initiating a switchover. Switchover due to AIS-L condition on this uplink will not be valid if any of the APS (Automatic Protection Switching) is enabled.

pdnLinkFailureSdPeriodBeforeSwitching.name: pdnLinkFailureSdPeriodBeforeSwitching
pdnLinkFailureSdPeriodBeforeSwitching.description: This object allows users to configure the amount of time a Signal Degraded (Sd) condition shall exist on this uplink before initiating a switchover. Switchover due to Sd condition on this uplink will not be valid if any of the APS (Automatic Protection Switching) is enabled.

pdnLinkFailureSfPeriodBeforeSwitching.name: pdnLinkFailureSfPeriodBeforeSwitching
pdnLinkFailureSfPeriodBeforeSwitching.description: This object allows users to configure the amount of time a Signal Failure Bit (Sf) condition shall exist on this uplink before initiating a switchover. Switchover due to Sf condition on this uplink will not be valid if any of the APS (Automatic Protection Switching) is enabled.

pdnLinkFailureSdBerThreshold.name: pdnLinkFailureSdBerThreshold
pdnLinkFailureSdBerThreshold.description: This object allows users to configure the threshold for the Signal Degrade Bit Error Rate (Sd). The negated value of this number is used as the exponent of 10 for computing the threshold value for the Bit Error Rate (BER). For example, a value of 5 indicates a BER threshold of 10^-5.

pdnLinkFailureSfBerThreshold.name: pdnLinkFailureSfBerThreshold
pdnLinkFailureSfBerThreshold.description: This object allows users to configure the threshold for the Signal Failure Bit Error Rate (Sf). The negated value of this number is used as the exponent of 10 for computing the threshold value for the Bit Error Rate (BER). For example, a value of 5 indicates a BER threshold of 10^-5.

pdnLinkFaultMgmtCompliance.name: pdnLinkFaultMgmtCompliance
pdnLinkFaultMgmtCompliance.description: The compliance statement for SNMP entities capable of configuring link fault conditions.

pdnLinkFaultMgmtGeneralGroup.name: pdnLinkFaultMgmtGeneralGroup
pdnLinkFaultMgmtGeneralGroup.description: A collection of configuration objects applicable to link fault mgmt implementation.

pdnLinkSwitchoverGroup.name: pdnLinkSwitchoverGroup
pdnLinkSwitchoverGroup.description: A collection of configuration objects applicable to all redundancy implementations.
